top_comment.author: Robbie Adams

comments.text:
All grains, most fruits.. None of them existed before people started 
meddling with them.


I'll give you one major example of a GMO food one would  every consider 
such... Popcorn... It was bread over dozens/hundreds of generations for a 
husk that would allow popping efficiency.

No 'direct' genetic manipulation..

Corn... Yeah, before humans got a hold of it it looked more like a wild 
grass. It's current 'common' form has NOTHING to do with natural selection 
and everything to do with human selection.

No matter where you draw the line the vast majority of the entire human 
species will be on the other side of it.
comments.author: Jake Heuft

comments.text:
This is a lost cause in the US though, it's like state gun laws... They're 
useless because they don't apply everywhere equally. The only chance for a 
GMO labeling scheme would have to be implemented on a federal level here 
(and in Canada as well)

Personally I think it's a waste of time, it breeds fear in the public and 
the VAST majority of crops in the US are in fact GMO foods.

Granted without proper definition of EXACTLY what GMO food means EVERY last 
staple crop that human beings use on this planet is GMO.

For some reason selective breeding/'natural grafting' isn't included in 
most people definition of GMO foods.

Look up Epigenetics if you want to muddy the field even furhter...

Unfortunately 90+% of the population is informed about these common 
practices and evolving sciences.
comments.author: Jake Heuft

comments.text:
GMO foods happens to be BIG BUSINESS in Canada and one of the reasons 
Canada also does not have GMO Labeling... It's the reason the Government 
wants to back GMO foods and not push for mandatory labeling. Which imo is 
INSANITY. We need to know what's in our food. Some GMO is a actually great 
and beneficial, however I want to know whats in the food I consume...

top_comment.text:
#gmo   #monsantoisevil   #statefoodlabelingrights  
"Monsanto Wins Fight to Take Away State Food Labeling Right
Published on May 26, 2013
Senator Bernie Sanders (I-VT) on Wednesday offered an amendment to the 
Senate's major farm bill that would allow
states to require labels on genetically engineered foods.
"Today we have an opportunity with this amendment to affirm once and for 
all that states do have the right to label food that contains genetically 
engineered ingredients," he said on the Senate floor."*
Senator Bernie Sanders (I-VT) fought hard to give his state and others the 
right to label GMO foods, but faced non-sensical opposition from 
Monsanto-bought Sen. Debbie Stabenow
(D-Mich.).
Did reason win? Cenk Uygur breaks it down."

A link which I found to an article about this:

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/05/23/gmo-labeling-bill-genetically-modified-food_n_3325972.html/
﻿

comments.text:
It is TRULY a shame....but people will chose to believe what they wish to 
believe....no matter what TRUE information is put in front of them....

As evidenced by the fact that they try to "confuse" the issue with insults, 
and wrong information....
Like attempting to compare "selective breeding" of plants through 
pollination....to "genetic modification"...to confuse the issue.

Nice attempt at misdirection.....BUT.....the truth cannot be hidden...

SORRY, nice try.....in a badly failing attempt to HIDE TRUTH.
comments.author: Eric Keytie

comments.text:
+Ben Geiger
SO....how do you explain the BT bacteria being found in INFANTS....whose 
parents have had NO contact with the product in their lives....other than 
EATING the food....???

I SUGGEST....that you actually READ articles before you try to refute 
information....hahah.

Take your "strong arm" tactic....to someone it will work on....and that is 
NOT me....hahah.
Calling ME a TROLL....only emphasizes my point, that you have to resort to 
slander, to support your QUICKLY eroding, and LOSING side of the 
debate.....HA.
comments.author: Eric Keytie

comments.text:
+Eric Kitei Bacillus thuringiensis being found in minute levels in the 
blood stream is not unexpected, the question was does enough of it get 
broken down that it is not at a toxic level or at a biologically active 
level, and it appears that it not negatively impacting humans who consume 
it.

I never mentioned lower yields as i have not heard about lower yields, i 
have heard about similar yields, and that was it.  aka that higher yields 
were not happening, but do you really need higher yields if you have other 
benefits.

Aspartame is safe, it is in fact the most studied food item, it breaks down 
into products we can digest. But this thread is about GMOs, but i guess 
mostly about Monsanto.  

Thank you for trolling,

I'm going to agree with +Juhana Tahvanainen that you can't reason with 
unreasonable people.  

As for the whole gun, virus, and antibiotic thing.  There are a couple ways 
to modify the genetics of a plant, one is to use an agrobacterium to insert 
genes into a plant flower that is passed onto its seeds, another is to 
shoot a gene gun (much lower yield and not that regulated) where you shoot 
nanoparticles of the genetics at the cell's nucleus and just hope you get 
it.

Do any of you believe in intelligent design as how humans got here?
comments.author: Ben Geiger

comments.text:
All I know is.....

Insults...from people who choose to remain un-informed....or insults from 
people who refuse to help others....or insults from people who want to 
"hide in the sand" and not see the truth.....insults from THOSE-TYPE 
people, I consider compliments.

If people who SUPPRESS the truth, and want to HIDE the truth, and want to 
LIE for PROFIT.....if THOSE people are insulting me, putting me down, and 
trying to STOP my information.....then....my information is DOING IT'S JOB.

TRUTH, does not need defending....if you let it OUT...it defends 
itself....because, there is no argument against the TRUTH.
